title: Tipping Point contestant suggests Anne Frank was a fictional character
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A Tipping Point contestant left viewers in shock last night when she implied Anne Frank was a fictional character.

Presenter Ben Shephard asked contestants Steph, a teacher, and Pete on a number of questions during a quickfire round, but Steph wasn’t entirely brushed up on her history or literature knowledge.

‘In a classic novel by Johanna Spyri, what is the name of the orphan sent to live with her grandfather in the Swiss Alps?’ Ben quizzed.

Unsure of the answer, Steph thought about handing over the question to her competitor.

‘I don’t know whether to pass it or not, I think Pete might know it,’ she said before she hazarded a guess and buzzed in with Anne Frank.

Steph was stumped by the question (Picture: ITV)

‘Anne Frank? Okay, Pete what would you have said?’ Ben asked.

‘I can think of Heidi,’ replied Pete.

Anne Frank was very much a real person (Picture: Getty)

Ben then revealed that Anne Frank was, in fact, incorrect and that Heidi was what he was looking for, adding: ‘Anne Frank was a real-life person of course.’

‘I knew that, I couldn’t think of anybody else,’ Steph said.

Viewers were shocked by Steph’s answer

#tippingpoint So Steph is a teacher and she thinks Anne Frank is a made-up character in a book. Says a lot about the state of the education system in this country — Louise Allen (@darciebean) October 22, 2019

How the hell can u not know Anne Frank is a real person? #tippingpoint — inganelson (@inganelson13) October 22, 2019

hang on if Anne Frank is fictional does that mean Heidi is real ? #tippingpoint — Happy Gaz (@gaz_happy) October 22, 2019

Did she really just say Anne Frank!? #TippingPoint pic.twitter.com/dMF6r5zgJT — Felix Wood (@felixw1) October 22, 2019

A teacher thinks Anne Frank is a fictional character #tippingpoint …. I just despair — Marge Dacre (@MargeDacre) October 22, 2019

You know Anne Frank, the fictional orphan? #TippingPoint — J🇬🇧🇳🇬 (@Artful_Doodler) October 22, 2019

Anne Frank, that well known girl who lived in the Swiss Alps! Please please tell me you didn’t just say that?! #tippingpoint pic.twitter.com/O2oMKT9tcq — Kevin Ticehurst (@Brightonfan) October 22, 2019

anne frank??????? she was real and not an orphan🤦🏻‍♀️ #tippingpoint — qween sammi (@Xx13BluebellaxX) October 22, 2019

Unsurprisingly, viewers were rather taken aback by Steph’s answer, with one scorning on Twitter: ‘Anne Frank, that well known girl who lived in the Swiss Alps! Please please tell me you didn’t just say that?!’

Echoing a similar sentiment, another said: ‘Hang on if Anne Frank is fictional does that mean Heidi is real?’

Anne Frank was a German-born Dutch-Jewish diarist and remains one of the most discussed Jewish victims of the Holocaust.

She gained fame posthumously with the publication of her diary The Diary of a Young Girl.

Unfortunately, Steph walked home after losing out to Pete in the head-to-head as the game show continued.

Pete, however, went on to bag an impressive £3450.

Tipping Point airs weekdays at 4pm on ITV.
